intro: Senecio pearcei, commonly known as the pearce's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in succulent gardens for its ornamental value.
